thread.section_title: Premier Inn London Waterloo (Westminster Bridge) Hotel - UPDATED 2017 Reviews & Price Comparison (England) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Small and Friendly
thread.title_full: Small and Friendly - Review of Premier Inn London Waterloo (Westminster Bridge) Hotel, London, England - TripAdvisor

author: Mikey444
title: Small and Friendly
text:
Hi, we stopped here for four nights in early March '17. The hotel is a bit smaller than the County Hall Hotel, about 100 yards away. It feels a bit more homely somehow. Our room was on the ground floor. It was spacious, clean and equipped to the usual "Premier" standard. There was however a small amount of traffic noise at rush hour, but it didn't bother us much. The bathroom was roomy, very clean and has a large walk in shower - great!!
All the reception staff were excellent - friendly and knowledgeable. All the staff were nice and helpful especially the young French waitress - didn't manage to catch her name. Breakfast was excellent and there was a wide choice of items at the "all you can eat" buffet. If you wanted the kitchen staff would do boiled eggs, poached eggs, omelettes or porridge.
All in all I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again
